roleset.name: banish, send away

example.name: almost adjectival
example.text: Within two years, the moderates were exiled [*]or in prison, Nicaragua had gone communist, and the Sandinistas were building one of the biggest armies in Latin America and threatening their neighbors.

example.name: ARG1
example.text: A Libyan dissident exiled in Egypt Mohammed Fias Jabrel says he is satisfied with the verdict because it proves Libya has committed crimes against innocent people but Mr. Jabrel says he hopes the case is not closed .

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: It was established by the 14th Dalai Lama in 1959 shortly after his exile from Tibet.

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: It's not that surprising that Republicans are reconsidering their exile of Akin.

roleset.note: EXILE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'exile' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry. (from exile.01-v predicate notes)
EXILE-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, exile-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls battle-36.4 (from exile.01-n)
